comments.value:
Hello

Have noticed that the 'francais' link in the top nav is only appearing on some pages e.g. it's not there on the hubs for 'Get involved now' or 'Making it happen'. I suspect that the whole site might need republishing - is that the case, and should I try to do it myself or could we schedule a global publish tonight so the top nav is updated?

Hi Morag,

Actually those pages appear different in preview as well, I wonder if they use a different header component, checking now.

Jamie

Hi Morag,

Ah figured it out..

It's because those pages don't have french versions.

Here is the complete list..

Jamie 

var blacklistedPaths = [
 "blog/",
 "get-involved/business-network/",
 "get-involved/cultural-olympiad/",
 "get-involved/education/",
 "get-involved/inspire-programme/",
 "get-involved/live-sites/",
 "get-involved/open-weekend/",
 "get-involved/volunteering/",
 "jobs/",
 "making-it-happen/art-on-the-olympic-park/",
 "making-it-happen/living-near-the-olympic-park/",
 "publications/",
 "videos/",
 "virtual-tours/",
 "index.php"
 ];
But something like â€˜Making it happenâ€™ hub doesnâ€™t have francais on it, and that page certainly has a French equivalent
fixed. The site doesn't need republishing. There was just a problem with three pages (which I've fixed, republished, etc.) Kieran.
Thank you, Kieran â€“ looks great

comments.value:
Hello

As of today we have a new Call Centre going live which will be processing all the public enquiries. This is run by a third party operator. 

Consequently we need to update the Contact us page so that any public enquiries directed to LOCOG will be forwarded directly to info@enquiries.london2012.com instead of enquiries@london2012.com 

Any questions in the drop down which relate to the ODA will not change their email address i.e. they continue to be directed to the existing email address.

Is it possible to set up this change asap today so that we have a smooth transfer to the new call centre provider?

Happy to answer questions. Many thanks!!
Priority changed to "urgent".

Hi Morag,

Have updated, but for future reference you can do it here yourself, may need to republish contact page after saving.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/emailContacts

Jamie

Thatâ€™s quite remarkable â€“ I had no idea we could control that.

Thanks very much!
I donâ€™t seem to have access to this through my CMS view â€“ should it be in the Data tab?
I dont' think it's currently linked to from anywhere in the CMS
Cool

subject: Change of email address on Contact us page - urgent
description:
Hello

As of today we have a new Call Centre going live which will be processing all the public enquiries. This is run by a third party operator. 

Consequently we need to update the Contact us page so that any public enquiries directed to LOCOG will be forwarded directly to info@enquiries.london2012.com instead of enquiries@london2012.com 

Any questions in the drop down which relate to the ODA will not change their email address i.e. they continue to be directed to the existing email address.

Is it possible to set up this change asap today so that we have a smooth transfer to the new call centre provider?

Happy to answer questions. Many thanks!!

Hello Liz,
I'd like to fix this - if it's still a problem.
Do you have any more information about how reproducible it is, or which pages it appears on?
Thanks,
Kieran
Well it would definitely be on the Open weekend event submission form. I havenâ€™t heard of any more problems, but if you can have a go at replicating i would appreciate it.

When you're opening the open weekend download in (presumably?) Excel, are you telling excel that the "character set" or "character encoding" is "utf-8" ?
My guess is that you might not be, in which case this is why the Windows curly left & right single & double quotes appear strange.
I would also expect you to be seeing "Ã‚Â£2000" instead of "Â£2000" - is that the case?

When you're opening the open weekend download in (presumably?) Excel, are you telling excel that the "character set" or "character encoding" is "utf-8" ?
My guess is that you might not be, in which case this is why the Windows curly left & right single & double quotes appear strange.
I would also expect you to be seeing "Ã‚Â£2000" instead of "Â£2000" - is that the case?

Iâ€™ll need to double check with the team. Thatâ€™s not the problem being referred to in this ticket, though! This is when an organisation actually goes onto the web form to submit an event. After hitting the â€˜submitâ€™ button, the page just goes completely blank (and it doesnâ€™t actually get submitted). Can you please check that?

Erm, maybe I'm getting confused, but I /think/ there is another ticket for that problem, which Janos is investigating: http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/932

/This/ ticket is specifically about the strange characters appearing in the downloaded csv file containing the open weekend events.

I appreciate it's probably lower priority than the other ticket though, so feel free to reply/investigate whenever you get time (or - indeed - to correct me if I'm wrong!)

Many thanks,
Kieran

Jeez â€“ youâ€™re right, Kieran! I skim read and made the wrong assumption! I think we are ok on the weird characters during export. And Iâ€™ll re-confrim the utf-8 note.

Go ahead and close this ticket!

Liz

comments.value:
Hello, we are using the same picture for a news story and the blog... do you know why the one on the news story is coming up as pixalated?

Thanks,

Sutveer

[cid:image005.jpg@01CAFDB6.E6AEEFE0][cid:image006.jpg@01CAFDB6.E6AEEFE0]

Hi Sutveer,

I think the problem is that the image is being 'blown up' on the news page and hence the pixelation.

Blog (440 pixels wide)
http://www.london2012.com/images/events/jonathan-edwards-launches-let-s-get-cooking-around-the-world.gif
http://www.london2012.com/blog/2010/05/inspiring-children-to-cook-and-learn-languages.php

News (stretched to 460 pixels wide)
http://www.london2012.com/transform/2892437/m460x/jonathan-edwards-launches-let-s-get-cooking-around-the-world.gif
http://www.london2012.com/news/2010/05/jonathan-edwards-declares-cooking-and-languages-a-recipe-for-success.php

If you already have an image that is 460px wide or bigger (it will get reduced down to fit) then it would be better to use that. Did this image come from Getty?

Otherwise I have attached a 460px wide version which I 'blew up' in Photoshop which doesn't suffer so badly from the pixelation.

Jamie

comments.value:
I could have sworn this was already in here - but I can't find it!  On the listings pages we need the information below, in that order.  Right now I think you might have the short and long descriptions backwards, when I look in preview?  And we don't need organisation on there.

1.	Event name
2.	Short description
3.      Picture
4.	Challenge (displayed in a very obvious way! -- I recognize you aren't designers, but if this can stand out in some way - bold/pink? that would be excellent)
5.      Type of event
6.	Long Description (this might be best suited to being at the end)
7.	Dates
8.	Timings
9.	Ticketing
10.	Venue Address & Post Code
11.	Accessible info
12.	Website

I'm about to go on holiday.  When this is done, can you please get a screenshot through to openweekend@london2012.com so they can see what it looks like?  Finn/Morag will also be able to help.

Can I just clarify your happy with us modifying the standard event 
page so it looks like below for *all* events, at least for the period 
leading up to the OW.

Obviously unused fields will just be hidden.

* we could look at making a separate set of OW event pages or 
adjusting the format depending on the type of event but that may just 
add confusion in the short term (given that 90% of events on the site 
over the next month I assume will be OW ones)

Fine to change it for all of them - obviously the 'challenge' field will be empty!
________________________________

OK thanks for the clarification,

Will do !
screen shot attached (I have highlighted the description field in the screenshot, rather than the challenge field, but the challange is the one that will be highlighted once this goes live)
Correct screen shot attached, awaiting sign off by OW team.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/events/uncovering-the-wyre-forest.php

comments.value:
As discussed (briefly) this morning, we need to start preparing for the eventual move of Kitsite CMS servers to BT's hosting environment later this year.

danny
To clarify: the immediate issue is whether and how it might make sense to introduce a staging server into the production environment (subject of ticket amended).
possibly a staging server for js and css and on an ad hoc basis for big changes.

Once Huw has it in place we'll need (at least) to:

- setup server as per web01
- allow access from Kitsite office / dev / milo etc. to new staging server (SSH/SFTP/HTTP/HTTPS etc.)
- turn off CMS publication
- run manual RSYNC from web01 --> to -> new staging srever
- disable  RSYNC script (on web01)
- copy current RSYNC script (on web01) to new staging machine and add a rule for web01 (question over who does this us or BT; as up till now it has been BT responsibility); new script should now sync from [ staging --> to -> web01-06 ]
- change above RSYNC to exclude .css and .js files.
- change CMS publication target to to new staging server / turn on publication
- Kitsite to check LUCKIT/Network/SMTP access (and anything else on K's sever sanity checklist)
- BT to possibly make changes if problems discovered above
- Kitsite to create a separate RSYNC script that only syncs CSS and JS files
- Document process to use above file.

Have just followed up direct with Jagdeep on this as well..

--

Hi Jagdeep,

I am waiting on confirmation form Morag but the Volunteering site is part of the main www.london2012.com site and lives in the main CMS instance.

It will live under /get-involved/volunteer (or /get-involved/volunteering) TBD

Therefore the server is identical to web01

--

The following is how I was imagining we we're planning to use the 'staging' server in the current environment:

- New server set up to act as if it was a new instance of (web01-06) lets call call it web00. (or staging.) as it will now become the first in the chain.
- Access to this server is only allowed to specific IP addresses (it is not part of the load balanced servers) *
- CMS publication is stopped
- The rsync scripts are moved from web01 to web00 (staging)
- We manually sync web01 to web00 (so that web00 has a full copy of the site)
- CMS publication is changed so that we now publish to web00 (staging)

We can then decide which content is automatically synced from web00 (staging) to web01-06; we can either stop any automatic syncing ie. when making a major site change, syncing of a section of a site (for launching a new section **) or just limit the auto syncing of CSS/JS (which we sync manually)

Does that sound similar to how you we're imaging it being used?

* we already have the 'direct access' to web01 which we access via SSH to 213.120.228.198 (rather than going via the load balancer 213.120.228.200) / yes we need root (or ss -) access, although we currently have this on on web01 / in effect we need a clone of web01 / the same access rights (server and firewall) as we have to web01

** although we can limit the automatic syncing of a given section or pages ie. /get-involved/volunteering we cannot stop pages outside of this section (which have been synced) from trying to link to new pages within this section. For example if we have a new page called /get-involved/volunteering/new.php then until we push that page out onto the live site, links to that page from pages outside of the /get-involved/volunteering section will result in a 404. We may be able to limit this using redirects. I think we probably need to look at this on a case by case basis, depending on exactly what we are trying to deploy.

* These are the machines / routers / IP's that currently have access to web01 (we need the same level of firewall access to the new server)
94.193.102.181 (kitsite office router)
89.187.66.118 (milo.kitsite.com)
89.187.66.113 (dev.kitsite.com)
89.187.66.117 (koala.kitsite.com)
89.187.66.120 (roo.kitsite.com)

Jamie

On 26 May 2010, at 17:47, Jagdeep Bhambra wrote:

Jamie

Iâ€™m working with BT to scope out the Staging environment â€“ this will also be used to host the volunteering site (which I believe youâ€™re working on).

Could you let me know the following:
a)       How is the site structured â€“ html, PhP, flash? Etc
b)       Access needed â€“ sudo? Root?
c)       Environment needed  - eg, Apache? Tomcat? PhP/core modules? Additional?
d)       Connectivity â€“ ssh preferable
e)       Who needs visibility of the site â€“ LOCOG/KitSite â€“ may need to inform BT with regards to firewall rules... (input from Morag/Huw?)

If you could let me know by COP today or tomorrow morning at the latest â€“ the meeting with BT is tomorrow afternoon

subject: ITS: Feedback on staging server
description:
As discussed (briefly) this morning, we need to start preparing for the eventual move of Kitsite CMS servers to BT's hosting environment later this year.

danny

Hi,

Wembley Arena is going to be the new venue for Rhythmic Gymnastics and Badminton.  So we need it added to the meta data, and be prepared to add a pic of it to the venues landing page (that will then show those two pictograms).

This is going live Thursday.  So high priority.

Thanks,

Liz

Liz Goulding
New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012

Have added  "Wembley Arena" to the list of "venue" values.
Just checking Venues homepage.
Cool, thanks. Please donâ€™t change venues landing page yet. Have to wait â€˜til Thur

Liz, can you bounce this ticket back to me when you have created the new venue page (or - indeed - if you want /me/ to create it).
I'll then set up the sports icons.
NB You can create it before Thursday. So long as it's not published, it won't appear on the live site,

Hi Liz, just to remind you:
Can you let me know when you are likely to launch this page please?
(or - indeed - if you already have!)
Thanks,
Kieran
Deborah, are we ready?
No! Not sure what the situation is but havenâ€™t had the go yet

Hi. I'm a bit confused by this ticket. I was awaiting someone's goahead but ... it never came.
The Wembley Arena page is now live, but ... has no image on it.
  http://www.london2012.com/games/venues/wembley-arena.php
I have amended it in the cms so that it now displays the correct sports icons.
However, I think someone needs to assign an image to it.
Let me know as soon as you're happy for it to be found on the website, as i need to (note to self):
  Set VenueType -> "London Venue" in the metadata pane.
  Republish venue page.
  Republish venue home.
Thanks,
Kieran

Ticket #910 "RE: [PostCMS support] Pending re..." was closed and merged into this ticket.

Last Comment in #910: Donâ€™t know â€“ sorry, had tried to get this as part of a different ticket (909?) that Kieran was dealing with with Liz!

If you open the page in the CMS, and then inspect the Metadata pane on the RHS, at the bottom you will see a "Sporticons" field.
If you just delete ", canoe-sprint" from this, and save, it should do what you want.
Kieran

When you say remove, does it need replacing or does this venue have no  
sports ?

The current pictogram lives here in the CMS if you want to replace it.
/images/icons/sports/canoe-slalom.gif


If you want o remove it completely then just remove the name from the  
Sportsicons meta-data tab and re-save/republish.

Don't worry, is fixed. Kieran's instructions worked!

Hi

 

Our photos on the venues pages don't seem to be appearing in the right
order.

Can you look into? They should be most recent first when you do a
search...

 

Thanks

 

Alex

http://www.london2012.com/photos/search.php?sport=Cycling&paralympic=Cyc
ling&venue=Velodrome&tag=velodrome&related=true&start=1

 

Alexandra Brown

Marketing Executive (New Media)

Communications

 

Olympic Delivery Authority

Mailpoint: 7A

23rd Floor, One Churchill Place

London E14 5LN

 

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6016

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001

www.london2012.com  

 

 

Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com

Searches come back grouped by day, week, month, year (or something 
like that)

But they don't come back in true 'date order' as what you are doing 
where you do a free text search is searching for 'likeness'

Is a page that is an exact match but is from last week less relevant 
than one published yesterday that just happens to have a similar title.

Tags on the other hand /should be/ in date order as you can either 
match a single tag or not match a single tag, their is no fuzzzyness.

Hi Alex,

We're looking at it in IE6 and it looks fine (actually the line is is bit off)

Do you see the same problem on all the images ?

Also is it just when the pages loads (or once the page has loaded) ?

The way that line / slope is handled is done differently for IE6, where in IE7/IE8/Firefox etc. it's just done by overlaying a logo with a transparent background. In IE6 it's done with some Javascript which may be why it doesn't appear till the page has fully loaded (and if the page doesn't fully load for some reason it may not work at all).

Jamie

Hi

 

I will need to check this next week when Iâ€™m on a computer with IE6.

 

Thanks


Alex

comments.value:
--

I wonder if it makes more sense for us to split the sponsors out so they have a page of their own (that is never linked to / is pretty much unbranded) and then pull them back into the sponsors page in the correct tier *and* in alphabetical order.

Would save the need to re-juggle to boxes round each time.

---

That sounds perfect to me in the long term - having to juggle around 
logos etc is a pain. So yes, please investigate.

---

Approx: 1/2 days work, but woudl need to reassign the logos links so maybe one for a future quite period / before a new sponsor comes along (you should be fine adding new text sponsors though)

Jamie, you may have noticed that when you change something to a 'task' it also requires a due date, so I tend to just call something a 'problem' until it actually has a due date requested by Morag or Liz.
Not needed, closing..

comments.value:
Hi,

Could you add this logo to our partner page? They are a tier 2 partner and so should be recognised in logo format between Adecco and Cadbury.

The url link for websites is www.arcelormittal.com

Thanks very much


From: Paul Deighton
Sent: 25 May 2010 15:18
To: #LOCOG All Staff Members
Subject: London 2012 confirm ArcelorMittal as tier two supporter

Dear all,

I am delighted to inform you that ArcelorMittal have become a Tier Two sponsor of London 2012 and Official Steel Supporter of the Games. Please find the press release below with more details.

Regards

Paul








[cid:image001.jpg@01CAFC1D.11810640]


[cid:image002.jpg@01CAFC1D.11810640]


25 May 2010


Media Release




London 2012 confirm ArcelorMittal as tier two supporter




The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games (LOCOG) is pleased to officially confirm ArcelorMittal as a Tier Two sponsor of London 2012 and Official Steel Supporter of the Games. The deal follows confirmation that ArcelorMittal will fund the construction of a 115m high visitor attraction in the Olympic Park in time for the Games, which will be designed by artist Anish Kapoor and structural engineer Cecil Balmond and named 'The Orbit' during Games time.

As part of the deal, LOCOG will benefit from the sale of tickets to visit the viewing platform of the tower around the Games, as well as being able to provide hospitality in the tower at Games-time. The tower is expected to be completed by May 2012 and will be an iconic presence on the skyline as well as providing visitors with spectacular views across the Olympic Park.

LOCOG Chairman Sebastian Coe commented, "The Olympic Games and Paralympic Games are already transforming east London and the addition of the Tower at Games-time will provide an added dimension to the Park. We are thrilled to have ArcelorMittal on board as a sponsor and I have great pleasure in welcoming them to the London 2012 family."

Lakshmi Mittal, Chairman and CEO of Arcelormittal, said: "With the Games being the world's biggest sporting event, we felt that London 2012 was the perfect sponsorship opportunity.  We're excited about being associated with this great global sporting event and being able to showcase the versatility of steel at it with the ArcelorMittal Orbit." He added, "I'm also personally pleased to be able to give a little something back with this initiative to London, which has been my home for many years."

The Orbit will stand in the southern part of the Olympic Park between the Stadium and Aquatics Centre. After completion, the Olympic Park Legacy Company will take ownership and run the tower.


- Ends -



For further information please contact the London 2012 Press Office on +44 (0)203 2012 100 or visit the website at www.london2012.com. Find out the latest from London 2012 HQ on our blog http://blog.london2012.com or follow us on Twitter http://www.twitter.com/london2012
Notes to editors:

As it heads towards its Â£2bn budget for staging the Olympic and Paralympic Games, LOCOG has seven domestic Tier One Partners - adidas, BMW, BP, British Airways, BT, EDF and Lloyds TSB. There are now seven domestic Tier Two Supporters - Adecco, ArcelorMittal, Cadbury, Cisco, Deloitte, Thomas Cook and UPS. There are sixteen domestic Tier Three Suppliers and Providers - Airwave, Atkins, Boston Consulting Group, Crystal CG, Eurostar, Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer LLP, GSK, Gymnova, Holiday Inn, John Lewis, McCann Worldgroup, Next, The Nielsen Company, Populous, Ticketmaster and Trident.

There is one domestic Tier One Paralympic Games Partner, Sainsbury's.

The Worldwide Olympic Partners signed up for London 2012 are Coca-Cola, Acer, Atos Origin, GE, McDonald's, Omega, Panasonic, Samsung and Visa.

comments.value:
Please see attached document.  Just ignore all the purple (free text) pieces.  Let me know if you have questions!

Estimate?

Hi Liz,

Tagging_-_the_ultimate_guide.doc

I though this was some kind of guide to starting out as a graffiti 
artist ;-)

Seriously though, what do you want us to do with this?

Are you asking us to update the taxonomies? If so could you label 
additions / deletions (deletions and updates are tricker *)

Freetext tags: you should be able to edit these yourself?

* deleting tags: from the taxonomy: do you want the tags removed from 
the pages themselves, obviously this requires some cleanup?
* updating tags: if we update a tag we also need to update any 
references to the old tag on pages.

Yes, I meant for u to ignore the freetext - this doc was created for cms
users as the primary audience. So all the things that aren't free tags
are the updated taxonomies we would like to use!

 

I think there are more replacements than there are deletions. I will
try and pull together a doc for you that has remove/continue/replace/new
on it, but it will take awhile.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Right. I have created a spreadsheet.  basically, anywhere i say, 'remove' it's removed as a theme, but we *will* be using it as a freetext tag.  So ideally, things carrying these themes will keep them, only they'll be 'demoted' to free text stuff.  Does that make sense?  That is true of all the organisations - we want things carrying the tags to keep them, but they'll be free text rather than drop-down.

K can you look at this or can we discuss what Janos would need to do (if he could).

We also need to get a quote back to Liz on this..

thanks

Jamie

Kieran to write Rhino methods for migrating metadata values.
Then Kieran/other to actually perform the migrations.
Estimate, discussed w. Jamie, 2 days.
Can we please make this high prirority, please?  It's related to the 'related events' ticket, as well

I'm not quite sure why this disappeared off my radar.
It might be because someone (maybe me) associated it with the "related events" ticket.
Anyhow ... it is now my top priority ticket.

> Right. I have created a spreadsheet. basically, anywhere i say, 'remove' it's 
> removed as a theme, but we *will* be using it as a freetext tag. So ideally, 
> things carrying these themes will keep them, only they'll be 'demoted' to free
> text stuff. Does that make sense? That is true of all the organisations - we
> want things carrying the tags to keep them, but they'll be free text rather 
> than drop-down.

This makes sense, after our discussion this morning. So thanks!
However I still have a couple more questions. They're fairly simple, but I just want to double-check before going ahead and updating all of the metadata (some of the updates are "destructive" - i.e. we're effectively discarding information, so I want to get it right!!).

You've only explicitly mentioned "themes" above. But I just want to double 
check that this applies to the other metadata types, too. Specifically:
 locations (East London,West,All,Greenwich,Hackney,Newham,Tower Hamlets,Walthamstow)
 venues    (Greenwich Arena,Paralympic Tennis and archery)
Also, can you just confirm that theme:Technology is should undergo this action. 
I ask, because it doesn't explicitly say "Remove" in the spreadsheet (but it IS
in amongst the other "Removed" values). 

"All locations". The spreadsheet implies that location:All should be moved to
the "freetext" tags. However, I don't think you really mean that hundreds of pages
should be tagged to "All". I'm guessing you want such pages to be tagged to 
"All locations", rather than simply "All". Am I correct?

So the three questions are:
1) Should the "removed" venues and locations be put into "freetext" tags.
2) Is theme:Technology a removed theme?
3) Should "location:All" be moved to "freetext:All", or "freetext:All locations", or maybe even "location:All locations".

Thanks,
Kieran
internal note: This might go above 2 days, as I've had to go through the spreadsheet line by line, and cross-check with what's in the db. Kieran

-- East London,West,All,Greenwich,Hackney,Newham,Tower Hamlets,Walthamstow) --> These should just be keywords.  They were never 'treated' any differently by being 'locations' so we might as well just leave them as key words, and then we can include other areas as well. 
-- I can't remember - does the doc suggest getting rid of locations? I can't remember.  If so then freetext:UK-wide and freetext: Host boroughs(I think that's in the doc somewhere), otherwise, location:UK-wide etc. is cool.
-- It's never the Greenwich arena, it's the North Greenwich arena.  And I don't the *think* Paralympic Tennis and Archery are their own venue any more.  So we don't need them to be specific venue, but can't hurt to have them as key words. Just check the live site to see what venue pages there are.  We might need to add more in the future, but for now I think we're ok.
-- Technology is a removed theme.  It should be a keyword instead!
Liz requested a couple more changes, so I've (with her agreement) upped the effort estimate to 2.5 days.
Park boroughs should be 5 host boroughs, please

Just to confirm our most recent conversation.
Anything that is tagged to location:All is being retagged to location:Around the UK.
Anything that is tagged to location:Park Boroughs is being retagged to location:5 host boroughs.
Anything that is tagged to location:East London,West,All,Greenwich,Hackney,Newham,Tower Hamlets,Walthamstow is being retagged to location:5 host boroughs. And the old tag is being moved into a freetext tag.
Perfect

Actually ... I'm tempted to up this to three days as:
1. Liz didn't balk at 2.5 days.
2. It has taken at LEAST 3 days (on account of testing it rigorously AND the fact that I had to proof read the spreadsheet!).
Estimate upped to 3 days (including proofing of spreadsheet and testing)
All metadata updated. Currently republishing. Will do some more testing this evening (Fri).

This has been completed. I'm interested to hear any feedback you might have.
fwiw, I'm archiving the code that I used here, so future metadata renames/additions/deletions should be much simpler.
